City Council
============

Eligibility for City Council candidacy during an election is governed by
**Title 9, Sec 141.001**
of the State of Texas Election Code and by
of the City of Watauga Home Rule Charter.  In any case in which the requirements are more restrictive in the City's Home Rule Charter as opposed to the State Election Code, the requirements in the City of Watauga Home Rule Charter prevail.

* [State of Texas Election Code Title 9](https://statutes.capitol.texas.gov/Docs/EL/htm/EL.141.htm#141.001)
* [City of Watauga Home Rule Charter and Code of Ordinances](https://www.cowtx.org/824/Code-of-Ordinances)

Form of Government
------------------

Watauga is led by a Mayor/Council/City Manager form of government, with the Mayor and all seven (7) City Council seats elected at-large for a three year term. Direct citizen input to City government takes the form of several volunteer boards, commissions and committees, which advise the City Council on a variety of issues such as crime prevention, parks, recreation and community services, etc.

Council Members
---------------

Terms of office for members of the city council shall be three years, in accordance with the following schedule. In May of 2025, the mayor and councilmembers in places 3, 4 and 5 shall be elected to terms of office of three years. In May of 2026, councilmembers in places 1, 2, 6 and 7 shall be elected to terms of office of three years. In May of 2027, and in May of each third year thereafter, no general election for mayor or councilmembers will be held, unless to fill a vacancy in office as may be needed.urrent Members

Miner](https://www.cowtx.org/803/Mayor) | ![Council Member Pat Shelbourne](https://www.cowtx.org/ImageRepository/Document?documentId=15683) [Pat Shelbourne - Place 1](https://www.cowtx.org/796/Council-Place-1) | ![Cris Blackburn](https://www.cowtx.org/ImageRepository/Document?documentId=17674) [Mayor Pro Tem Cris Blackburn](https://www.cowtx.org/797/Council-Place-2) | ![Lovie Downey](https://www.cowtx.org/ImageRepository/Document?documentId=17290) [Lovie Downey - Place 3](https://www.cowtx.org/798/Council-Place-3) |
| ![Andrew Neal](https://www.cowtx.org/ImageRepository/Document?documentId=17677) [Andrew Neal - Place 4](https://www.cowtx.org/799/Council-Place-4) | ![Blank Profile](https://www.cowtx.org/ImageRepository/Document?documentId=11214) Vacant - Place 5 | ![Council Member Mark Taylor](https://www.cowtx.org/ImageRepository/Document?documentId=15682) [Mark Taylor - Place 6](https://www.cowtx.org/801/Council-Place-6) | ![Jan Hill](https://www.cowtx.org/ImageRepository/Document?documentId=17291) [Jan Hill - Place 7](https://www.cowtx.org/802/Council-Place-7) |

Watauga City Council Regular Meetings are approved a year in advance by City Council and are
scheduled on the second and fourth Monday of each month.  When approving the Regular Meeting schedule, City Council takes into consideration various factors such as holidays and Charter provisions.  Special City Council Meetings are called as needed and notice of all meetings can be found on the required bulletin boards at City Hall.  Regular City Council Meetings and Special City Council Meetings are held at City Hall in the City Council Chamber located at 7105 Whitley Road, Watauga, Texas 76148.

[View agendas, minutes or video streaming](https://www.cowtx.org/1403/Agendas-and-Minutes)

|  |  |
| --- | --- |
| January 12, 2026 & January 26, 2026 | July 13, 2026 & July 27, 2026 |

| May 11, 2026 & May 25, 2026 | November 9, 2026 & November 23, 2026 |
| June 8, 2026 & June 22, 2026 | December 14, 2026 |
